comments.body: i would argue it also is used for files WITH it i.e modules

I'm not sure if the bot combines support from ANSIBLE_METADATA and BOTMETA.yml.

I don't think we've set `support` for any modules in here.

> I'm not sure if the bot combines support from ANSIBLE_METADATA and BOTMETA.yml.

Should a file be able to be supported both by `community` and `core` ? (response should be part of the [list of rules being defined](https://github.com/ansible/ansibullbot/pull/1008#pullrequestreview-150104847)) I mean is that `combine` or `override` ?

It seems that Ansibullbot is able to do that - using the `supported_by` keyword, not `support` -  and despite `supported_by` was never used in `BOTMETA.yml`:

1. `supported_by` `BOTMETA` has higher precedence than `supported_by` `ANSIBLE_METADATA` ([see](https://github.com/ansible/ansibullbot/blob/6ab590c39278471986a73d11d13fd6114fdb99f3/ansibullbot/utils/component_tools.py#L218-L219)).
2. when  `supported_by` is set,  `meta[support]` is equal to this variable ([see](https://github.com/ansible/ansibullbot/blob/6ab590c39278471986a73d11d13fd6114fdb99f3/ansibullbot/utils/component_tools.py#L1126))

@gundalow let me know if we should get rid of `supported_by` in `BOTMETA`, meaning:
- either forbidding `BOTMETA` to override `supported_by` from `ANSIBLE_METADATA` 
- or allowing `BOTMETA` to override `supported_by`  from `ANSIBLE_METADATA` using `support` keyword.

* My understanding is that a file must be supported by exactly ONE entity
* I think `ANSIBLE_METADATA` should override `BOTMETA`. This is because `ANSIBLE_METADATA` is used by the docsite
* AFAIK only Ansible Modules currently have a way of setting `support` via `ANSIBLE_METADATA`, it's possible in the future this may extend to other plugins.
I wonder if this can be done by ignoring `BOTMETA` `support` for modules, therefore ONLY using what's in `ANSIBLE_METADATA`
@gundalow that is a team decision to make. Create a bot issue and add it to a core team agenda or whatever it takes to drive a decision/consensus.

We currently don't set `support` for anything under `lib/ansible/modules/` in BOTMETA

So I think the discussion here is about future proofing, and possibly adding ANSIBLE_METADATA to other plugin types (which would allow docs to show support status)

So I think this discussion is about future proofing/adding ANSIBLE_METADATA to other plugins

Therefore what's current in BOTMETA and Ansibulbot meta is correct

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +29,33 @@#           keywords - used to identify this file based on the issue description
#           support - used for files without internal ANSIBLE_METADATA, see
#                     https://github.com/ansible/ansible/labels?q=support for full list
#           labels - list of GitHub labels to apply. Path components of 'file' parent key
#                    which are valid GitHub labels are automatically added.

comments.body: AFAIK, `support` key [isn't propagated to subpaths](https://github.com/ansible/ansibullbot/blob/f363f697da369fa123d701d74981fdc3d9a52c8e/ansibullbot/parsers/botmetadata.py#L113).
Fixed by https://github.com/ansible/ansibullbot/pull/1010, thanks Pilou
